DOC.brief_summary: The intraperitoneal repair has been proven safe for the repair of incisional hernia and is accepted, together with the subfascial or retromuscular repair as the "gold-standard" for the repair of incisional hernia. However no studies have convincingly proven that this approach is better than the on-lay repair. The authors believe that the intraperitoneal repair performs better than the on-lay repair for incisional hernia.
DOC.brief_title: Long-term Follow-up of Incisional Hernia Repaired With Intraperitoneal Mesh
DOC.criteria: Patients with incisional hernia 5 cm of diameter or with an area of 25 square cm (cm2) First repair Older than 35 years of age and younger than 75 years of age Both genders Any BMI Only upper abdominal midline incisional hernias (supraumbilical) Patients submitted only to elective repair Recurrent incisional hernia Emergency surgery Hernias with a diameter higher than 5 cm or more than 25 cm2 of area Lower midline abdominal incisional hernias Other hernias rather than midline incisional hernias Nonincisional hernias
DOC.keyword: First repair (no recurrent hernia will be included)
